intro: Bunium collinum, commonly known as mountain fennel, is a flowering plant native to the mountainous regions of Europe and Asia. It belongs to the Apiaceae family, which includes other aromatic herbs like parsley and dill. The plant is characterized by its tall, branched stems and small, yellowish flowers that appear in umbels. Its leaves are finely divided and have a distinctive, somewhat fern-like appearance. Bunium collinum is often found in rocky or gravelly soils and is adapted to harsh, high-altitude environments.
